title: Data Scientist
description: To help keep everyone safe, we encourage all applicants to pay close attention to protect themselves during their job search. When applying for a position online you are at risk of being targeted by malicious actors looking for personal data. Please be aware we will only reach out via email using the domain quanata.com. Anything that does not match those domains should be ignored and considered a security risk. About Us Quanata is on a mission to help ensure a better world through context-based insurance solutions. We are an exceptional, customer centered team with a passion for creating innovative technologies, digital products, and brands. We blend some of the best Silicon Valley talent and cutting-edge thinking with the long-term backing of leading insurer, State Farm. Learn more about us and our work at quanata.com Our Team From data scientists and actuaries to engineers, designers and marketers, we’re a world class team of tech-minded professionals from some of the best companies in Silicon Valley, and around the world.  We’ve come together to create the context-based insurance solutions and experiences of the future.  We know that the key to our success isn't just about nailing the technology—it’s hiring the talented people who will help us continue to make a quantifiable impact. The role We’re looking for an accomplished and well-rounded Data Scientist to help us build innovative personal auto pricing models and process telematics data for signal processing and feature engineering. This role reports to our Data Science Director and will be a key contributor to the development of new pricing models that align with Quanata’s mission to revolutionize transportation risk prediction. You’ll work closely with a collaborative team of data scientists, using cloud-based notebooks, proprietary modeling libraries and version control systems to deliver impactful results that drive the future of risk prediction. Your day-to-day Design, build, and refine personal auto insurance pricing models, leveraging historical data to improve prediction accuracy. Develop and implement feature engineering pipelines for telematics data, including signal processing techniques to extract actionable insights. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including actuarial, product, and data engineering teams, to integrate models and data into broader business solutions. Maintain and optimize cloud-based data science environments, including notebooks and version control systems. Analyze large datasets, both structured and unstructured, to uncover trends and support decision-making. Present findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders, translating complex data into actionable business strategies. Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies in telematics, data science, and transportation risk modeling. About you Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant work experience and 8 years of relevant work experience OR Master’s degree in quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, applied mathematics, computer science or a related field) and 6 years relevant experience Strong experience with Python and SQL, particularly in cloud-based environments. ● Proven ability to work independently and in teams on complex data projects, from inception to delivery. Obsessed with the latest developments in machine learning algorithms and data science practices. Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Passion for developing high quality models and shipping frequently. Bonus points PhD in a quantitative discipline. Actuarial designation or progress toward one. Prior experience in auto insurance, particularly in cost modeling and working with large datasets (semi-structured or unstructured). Hands-on experience with telematics data and signal processing. Salary: $200,000 to $300,000* *Please note that the final salary offered will be determined based on the selected candidate's skills, and experience, as well as the internal salary structure at Quanata. Our aim is to offer a competitive and equitable compensation package that reflects the candidate's expertise and contributions to our organization. Additional Details: Benefits : We provide a wide variety of health, wellness and other benefits.These include medical, dental, vision, life insurance and supplemental income plans for you and your dependents, a Headspace app subscription, monthly wellness allowance and a 401(k) Plan with a company match. Work from Home Equipment : Given our virtual environment— in order to set you up for success at home, a one-time payment of $2K will be provided to cover the purchase of in-home office equipment and furniture at your discretion. Also, our teams work with MacBook Pros, which we will deliver to you fully provisioned prior to your first day. Paid Time Off: All employees accrue four weeks of PTO in their first year of employment.  New parents receive twelve weeks of fully paid parental leave which may be taken within one year after the birth and/or adoption of a child. The twelve weeks is applicable to both birthing and non-birthing parent. Personal and Professional Development: We’re committed to investing in and helping our people grow personally and professionally.  All employees receive up to $5000 each year for professional learning, continuing education and career development.  All team members also receive LinkedIn Learning subscriptions and access to multiple different coaching opportunities through BetterUp. Location : We are a remote-first company for most positions so you may work from anywhere you like in the U.S, excluding U.S. territories. For most positions, occasional travel may be requested or encouraged but is not required . Some positions might require travel per the job description provided to the employee. Employees based in the San Francisco Bay Area or in Providence, Rhode Island may commute to one of our local offices as desired. Hours : We maintain core meeting hours from 9AM - 2PM Pacific time for collaborating with team members across all time zones. Quanata, LLC is an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. If you are a San Francisco resident, please read the City and County of San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance notice. https://www.sf.gov/sites/https://www.sf.gov/sites/default/files/2022-12/FCO poster2020_0.pdf This role is employed by Quanata, LLC which is a separate company in the State Farm family of companies. If you require a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to your Talent Acquisition Partner for assistance.
erros_textuais:
1.  "Please be aware we will only reach out via email using the domain quanata.com. Anything that does not match those domains should be ignored and considered a security risk.” - This phrasing is overly alarmist and could be reworded for a more professional tone.
2.  "Our aim is to offer a competitive and equitable compensation package that reflects the candidate's expertise and contributions to our organization.” - This sentence is slightly redundant.
3.  “Also, our teams work with MacBook Pros, which we will deliver to you fully provisioned prior to your first day.” - Could be more concise (e.g., “We provide MacBook Pros, fully provisioned, prior to your first day.”)

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description: We are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer to join our passionate and diverse Data Team. Treatwell is an organisation built on data, but we’re just getting started. In this role, you will be instrumental in shaping our future by ensuring that our data models and analytical capabilities adapt to the rapid pace of our business. As part of the Data Domain Team, you will take ownership of the end-to-end delivery of our data products designed to empower analysts, product managers, and key business stakeholders with valuable insights. You will collaborate closely with various teams to understand their needs and translate them into actionable data assets. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in SQL and data model design to deliver the right data in the best format through self-serve tools. We value open-source platforms such as DBT, Airbtye, Docker, Gitlab and Airflow orchestration in our tech stack. Our services run on a modern cloud platform using Amazon AWS, including Redshift, ECS, Lambda, Cloudwatch, S3, EMR, EC2, Athena. Additionally, we incorporate third-party tools like Fivetran, Monte Carlo, Looker, JIRA, and Slack, while continuously evaluating new technologies to enhance our data strategy. About Treatwell Hi, we’re Treatwell. Nice to meet you. We’re a team of 500 (and growing) passionate and brilliantly talented people across Europe. We’re the industry’s smartest salon management software, all connected to Europe’s leading booking platform, working with over 31,000 salon partners across 13 countries and processing over 4 million bookings every month. And….breathe. But we’re not done yet. We’re on an exciting journey to digitally revolutionise the hair and beauty community. If this excites you, we might have just the role for you. You will be responsible for: Collaborate with various business teams to understand their needs and create relevant data assets that reveal performance and key action points within their areas Perform data modelling of core data assets using SQL, DBT, and LookML Contribute to the strategy and design of data models and the data warehouse Support the discovery and integration of new data from various sources (OLTP, APIs, S3) Empower analysts and business users through self-serve tools, education, and documentation Define and manage data quality, documentation, observability and governance of core data models Manage data exposures in our BI Tool, Looker, ensuring smooth delivery of data to the business Automate repetitive analyses and tasks whenever possible Foster a data-driven culture and approach to decision-making Collaborate with analysts, stakeholders, and data engineers on broader analytics projects Assist with both ad-hoc requests and the automation of regular reporting for the business Requirements About You Strong experience with data modelling and data design concepts, especially Dimensional Models (Kimball, Inmon, Data Marts) but also OBT Excellent SQL skills with a focus on writing performant queries. Experience in other programming languages, such as Python, is a plus A passionate team player who enjoys collaborating and pairing to achieve shared goals Articulate communicator comfortable discussing technical matters with both engineers and stakeholders at all levels of the business Experienced in working with and understanding various business functions such as product, marketing, commercial, and finance teams Creative problem solver with an understanding of when a minimally viable solution can deliver 80% of the required needs ahead of a fully perfect solution Proficient with version control principles, git, and the command-line interface Familiarity with ETL (ELT) Tools such as DBT (preferred), GCP,  SSIS, Databricks, Airflow Analytical mindset with exposure to data warehouses from a previous role You are experienced with BI Visualisation tools Prior experience using DBT and LookML is a plus You can communicate fluently in English Benefits We’ll treat you with: 28 days holiday, plus bank holidays Monthly 40 EUR Treatwell vouchers so you can treat yourself too. Growth funds for you to develop and grow with your team. Equal Ops Treatwell is an ‘Open to All’ employer and warmly welcomes everybody to the team. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process as required. Please add any adjustment requests to your application. About the company We’re Treatwell (hi, hello), and we’re the place to book hair and beauty online. We spend our days working toward our mission to transform the way the hair and beauty community, and their clients, connect. Working isn’t quite the right word though… Our family – yes, we went there – are a collaborative, inspiring, challenging, (modest), group of individuals literally shifting the way the world books hair and beauty. We face our challenges, of course. The biggest one being that 70% of people still book their hair and beauty offline – like phoning the salon or walking straight in. That means, not only do we need a great product, and the right kind of marketing, we need to actually change the mindset of the majority. See? Challenge. With a clear set of values (four specifically; we raise the bar, we put customers first, we are genuinely open, and we work together beautifully), we become a stronger industry leader everyday. But, getting there means constantly evolving our team, and you might be the ideal addition.
erros_textuais:
1.  "Airbtye" should be "Airbyte".
2.  "Nice to meet you. We’re a team of 500 (and growing) passionate and brilliantly talented people across Europe." - Redundant and slightly informal for a professional description.
3.  "You are experienced with BI Visualisation tools Prior experience using DBT and LookML is a plus" - Could be more concise and impactful.

essa foi a analise

title: Senior Power BI Engineer
description: Maybe you’re bored and need a new challenge. Or you’re tired of being the lone BI person stuck in a never-ending reporting cycle with no room to think strategically. Or maybe you just want to work somewhere that values storytelling with data as much as technical chops. Whatever the reason, we want you to know that LT is different. And not just air quotes “different,” but more like “I actually look forward to Mondays again” different. It’s a place where you can write your own story and make a difference along the way. At LT, you’ll have the freedom and flexibility to do what you think needs to be done, and you’ll get to do it while working alongside a team of other curious individuals who love a good challenge too. We’re currently looking to add a Senior Power BI Engineer to this nerd club of ours. If you’re someone who has 5+ years of experience turning messy data into meaningful insights, we’d love to chat. Here’s what you can expect as a Senior Power BI Engineer at LT: You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams—engineers, analysts, product managers, and clients—to design, build, and maintain Power BI dashboards that actually get used (and loved). You’ll help clients define KPIs that matter and create visual stories that make those numbers actionable. You’ll coach clients and teammates on Power BI best practices, modern data architecture, and why “more filters” isn’t always the answer. You’ll push beyond basic reports to help automate insights, detect anomalies, and drive business strategy with data. You’ll keep learning—because that’s who you are—and we’ll support you with the time, tools, and resources to grow in your career.
motivos: Sem salário claro; Poucas techs relevantes
erros_textuais:
*   "air quotes “different”" – Uso excessivo e um pouco artificial de aspas.
*   "You’ll push beyond basic reports" – Pode ser mais conciso.
*   Repetição de "You’ll" – Pode ser simplificado.

essa foi a analise

title: Data Scientist Specialist
description: Come Make an Impact on Millions of Brazilians! At RecargaPay, we’re on a mission to deliver the best payment experience for Brazilian consumers and small businesses — by building a powerful digital ecosystem where the banked and unbanked connect, and where consumers and merchants have a one-stop shop for all their financial needs. We serve over 10 million users and process more than USD 4 billion annually. We’ve been profitable since 2022 and operate our own credit business. We are an AI-first, 100% remote team, scaling in the rapidly changing Brazilian financial market. Our goal? Deliver the best payment experience in Brazil for people and small businesses alike. We value autonomy, ownership, and a bias for action. We’re looking for people who are curious, hands-on, and driven by impact — who want to solve real problems, work with strong teams, and rethink what’s possible. If you’re ready to do your best work, at scale, with purpose — this is your place. Responsibilities As a Specialist Data Scientist on Product team, you will be responsible for: ● Developing and implementing real-time scoring models: Design and implement solutionsto quantify the risk level of transactions and credit operations, ● Optimizing user onboarding: Build predictive models using internal and third-party data, improving onboarding quality and reducing losses, ● Transforming our rule engine: Evolve our static rule engine into a dynamic and conditional graph-based rule engine, enabling more intelligent and adaptable rule management, ● Develop and implement fingerprinting and geographic tracking solutions to improve risk assessment, ● Leading the adoption of new technologies: Drive the adoption of technologies like Databricks and Data Catalogue in the team, advocating for best practices and facilitating the transition to a more modern and efficient data environment, ● Data modeling and advanced analytics: Analyze large volumes of transactional, user behavior, and demographic data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for improvement in risk assessment, ● Mentorship and technical leadership: Guide and mentor team members, sharing your experience and knowledge, and leading key projects from a technical perspective, ● Defining success metrics: Establish clear and relevant metrics to measure the impact of Data Science projects and operational efficiency improvement Requirements ● Demonstrable experience in building and implementing machine learning models, ● Deep knowledge of classification, regression, and clustering algorithms, as well as feature engineering and model selection techniques, ● Strong programming skills in Python, SQL, and Spark, ● Experience with platforms like Databricks, AWS and Azure, ● Knowledge of relational databases (PostgreSQL) and messaging tools (Kafka, SQS). ● Experience in developing and implementing real-time scoring, ● Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and concisely to technical and non-technical audiences, ● Analytical mindset and results-oriented, with a strong focus on problem-solving. ● Passion for innovation and experimentation. ● Knowledge of data modeling principles and experience in building robust and scalable data models. ● Strong mathematical skills and ability to optimize complex problems. Bonus Points ● Experience with graph-based rule engines. ● Knowledge of fingerprinting and geographic tracking techniques. ● Expertise in MLOPs Benefits Competitive and market-aligned salary. Remote work — wherever you are, you’re part of the team! Home office allowance through a monthly deposit in the RecargaPay app. Health and dental plans with no co-pay. Life insurance. Flexible meal allowance (via Flash). TotalPass membership to take care of your health. Spanish or Portuguese classes. Diversity & Inclusion at RecargaPay At RecargaPay, you’ll have the freedom to be who you are because we believe that diverse perspectives and experiences make us more creative and stronger. Here, everyone is welcome to express themselves authentically. We value the richness of each journey and the multiple ways of seeing the world, without distinctions of gender, race, sexual orientation, age, religion, or any other characteristic that makes us unique. About the use of your Data By sharing your resume with us, you authorize the use of your data for analysis during the selection process and possibly for other opportunities within the RecargaPay group. You can request the update or deletion of your information at any time, in accordance with LGPD (General Data Protection Law). About the company RecargaPay is the payments app for all Brazilians whose mission is to democratize mobile payments & financial services in Brazil. We strive to empower individuals and small businesses to take control of their financial lives. In an easy, fast, and secure way, we facilitate access to customers & merchants to solve their needs with convenience, security, and without the need to wait in lines. It's easier to pay bills with the options of installments in up to 12x, to cash in using boleto, credit card, debit cards, loans, QR codes, mPOS and Pix, and cash-out with multiple efficient alternatives. Founded in 2010 by Rodrigo Teijeiro (CEO), Alvaro Teijeiro (CTO) and Gustavo Victorica (COO). RecargaPay has raised over US$ 80 million in venture capital from a group of investors led by IFC, DN Capital, FJ Labs, The Venture City, IDC, ATW and more than 100 angel investors from AngelList and FundersClub. WE BELIEVE That we live in an era of constant disruption, vast opportunities, and ample liquidity to be put at the service of new ideas. That a smartphone per every human is just a matter of time and all industries will be disrupted as a consequence. That small interdisciplinary teams, committed to solving complex problems at scale, are the best positioned to have a deep and positive impact. WE ARE A BOLD, PASSIONATE GROUP OF INDIVIDUALS WITH VAST EXPERIENCE BUILDING COMPANIES AND PRODUCTS ON THE BASIS OF THESE CONVICTIONS, ALL AIMING TO MAKE YOUR LIFE EASIER THROUGH APPLIED TECHNOLOGY.
erros_textuais:
1. **Redundancy:** "We value autonomy, ownership, and a bias for action." - This could be more concise, perhaps focusing on core values.
2. **Repetitive phrasing:** The phrase "real-time scoring" is repeated multiple times throughout the responsibilities section. Consider variations like "dynamic scoring" or "instant risk assessment."
3. **Informal tone:** The opening sentence, "Come Make an Impact on Millions of Brazilians!" is overly enthusiastic and somewhat informal for a professional job description. It could be rephrased for a more polished presentation.

essa foi a analise

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description: About Us: At CompassX, our clients rely on us to lead high-priority strategic initiatives and transformational projects.  Our mission is to create a community of people who come up with innovative approaches and deliver the best outcomes for our clients. You will have the opportunity to leverage your experience, creativity, and skills to impact your clients and influence the trajectory of our firm to achieve growth for the team and your career. We are honored to be recognized as a “Best Place to Work” in Southern California and listed as one of INC.’s 5000 fastest-growing private companies in the U.S. We’re looking for a well-rounded Business Intelligence Engineer (Power BI) to support one of our life sciences clients. This role sits at the intersection of architecture, analytics, and delivery - ideal for someone who can own the full data workflow from source to visualization. You’ll be based in the US (ideally EST), and work closely with both US and EU-based teams, collaborating on the foundational build of a reporting and analytics environment. The client environment is still maturing, so your ability to shape structure, define logic, and deliver value will be key. What you'll do Design and implement star schema models and semantic layers that power consistent and scalable reporting Perform source-to-target data mapping , including building data lineage documentation Define and document key business KPIs and metrics Partner with business and technical stakeholders to align on data definitions and reporting needs Develop Power BI dashboards and outputs based on the underlying data models This role combines aspects of being an Analyst, Engineer, and Architect as you build an end-to-end business intelligence solution. What we're looking for Experience across the full data workflow: from source analysis and modeling through to dashboard development in Power BI Expertise in data architecture concepts, including dimensional modeling , data lineage , and semantic models Strong experience with Power BI , including DAX and building user-friendly dashboards Excellent fundamentals, where you are capable of writing complex SQL queries through to big picture thinking Comfortable working in a fast-moving, collaborative environment with cross-functional global teams
erros_textuais:
1. "You’ll be based in the US (ideally EST)" – Poderia ser mais claro: "Você estará sediado nos EUA (preferencialmente no fuso horário EST)."
2. "This role combines aspects of being an Analyst, Engineer, and Architect" – Sugestão: "Esta função combina as responsabilidades de Analista, Engenheiro e Arquiteto."
3. "Experience across the full data workflow: from source analysis and modeling through to dashboard development in Power BI" – Poderia ser mais conciso: "Experiência completa no fluxo de dados: da análise e modelagem da fonte ao desenvolvimento de dashboards no Power BI."

essa foi a análise
